docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 17 -- Federal regulatory agencies are taking a tolerant view of drugs and devices that have found a growing market among cigarette users concerned about the effect of smoking on their health.

headline.main: ANTISMOKING AIDS FIND BIG MARKET; A Tolerant View Is Taken by Federal Agencies

docs.abstract: Fed regulatory agencies have adopted policy of neither encouraging nor restricting ad, sale and use of products to help smokers quit; FTC has reptd that Acquafilter does remove tar and nicotine from cigarette smoke, PHS that products containing lobeline sulfate may help some smokers quit; other antismoking preparations listed
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 17 -- Federal regulatory agencies are taking a tolerant view of drugs and devices that have found a growing market among cigarette users concerned about the effect of smoking on their health.
